net.dv8tion.jda.core.managers

Class ChannelManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dv8tion.jda.core.managers.ChannelManager

  • public class ChannelManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Facade for a ChannelManagerUpdatable instance.
    Simplifies managing flow for convenience.

    This decoration allows to modify a single field by automatically building an update RestAction

      • setName

        public AuditableRestAction<java.lang.Void> setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the selected Channel.

        A channel name must not be null nor less than 2 characters or more than 100 characters long!
        TextChannel names may only be populated with alphanumeric (with underscore and dash).

        Example: mod-only or generic_name
        Characters will automatically be lowercased by Discord!

        Parameters:
        name - The new name for the selected Channel
        Returns:
        AuditableRestAction
        Update RestAction from #update()
        Throws:
        InsufficientPermissionException - If the currently logged in account does not have the Permission MANAGE_CHANNEL
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided name is null or not between 2-100 characters long
        See Also:
        ChannelManagerUpdatable.getNameField(), ChannelManagerUpdatable.update()

      • setParent

        public AuditableRestAction<java.lang.Void> setParent(Category category)
        Sets the Parent Category of the selected Channel.
        Parameters:
        category - The new parent for the selected Channel
        Returns:
        AuditableRestAction
        Update RestAction from #update()
        Throws:
        InsufficientPermissionException - If the currently logged in account does not have the Permission MANAGE_CHANNEL
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided category is not from the same Guild
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the target is a category itself
        Since:
        3.4.0
        See Also:
        ChannelManagerUpdatable.getParentField(), ChannelManagerUpdatable.update()

      • setPosition

        public AuditableRestAction<java.lang.Void> setPosition(int position)
        Sets the position of the selected Channel.

        To modify multiple channels you should use Guild.getController().modifyTextChannelPositions() instead! This is not the same as looping through channels and using this to update positions!

        Parameters:
        position - The new position for the selected Channel
        Returns:
        AuditableRestAction
        Update RestAction from #update()
        Throws:
        InsufficientPermissionException - If the currently logged in account does not have the Permission MANAGE_CHANNEL in the Guild!
        See Also:
        ChannelManagerUpdatable.getPositionField(), ChannelManagerUpdatable.update()

      • setTopic

        public AuditableRestAction<java.lang.Void> setTopic(java.lang.String topic)
        Sets the topic of the selected TextChannel.

        A channel topic must not be more than 1024 characters long!
        This is only available to TextChannels

        Parameters:
        topic - The new topic for the selected TextChannel, null or empty String to reset
        Returns:
        AuditableRestAction
        Update RestAction from #update()
        Throws:
        InsufficientPermissionException - If the currently logged in account does not have the Permission MANAGE_CHANNEL
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the selected Channel's type is not TEXT
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided topic is greater than 1024 in length
        See Also:
        ChannelManagerUpdatable.getTopicField(), ChannelManagerUpdatable.update()

      • setNSFW

        public AuditableRestAction<java.lang.Void> setNSFW(boolean nsfw)
        Sets the nsfw flag of the selected TextChannel.
        Parameters:
        nsfw - The new nsfw flag for the selected TextChannel,
        Returns:
        AuditableRestAction
        Update RestAction from #update()
        Throws:
        InsufficientPermissionException - If the currently logged in account does not have the Permission MANAGE_CHANNEL
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the selected Channel's type is not TEXT
        See Also:
        ChannelManagerUpdatable.getNSFWField(), ChannelManagerUpdatable.update()

      • setUserLimit

        public AuditableRestAction<java.lang.Void> setUserLimit(int userLimit)
        Sets the user-limit of the selected VoiceChannel.
        Provide 0 to reset the user-limit of the VoiceChannel

        A channel user-limit must not be negative nor greater than 99!
        This is only available to VoiceChannels

        Parameters:
        userLimit - The new user-limit for the selected VoiceChannel
        Returns:
        AuditableRestAction
        Update RestAction from #update()
        Throws:
        InsufficientPermissionException - If the currently logged in account does not have the Permission MANAGE_CHANNEL
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the selected Channel's type is not VOICE
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided user-limit is negative or greater than 99
        See Also:
        ChannelManagerUpdatable.getUserLimitField(), ChannelManagerUpdatable.update()

      • setBitrate

        public AuditableRestAction<java.lang.Void> setBitrate(int bitrate)
        Sets the bitrate of the selected VoiceChannel.
        The default value is 64000

        A channel bitrate must not be less than 8000 nor greater than 96000 (for non-vip Guilds)! VIP Guilds allow a bitrate for up to 128000.
        This is only available to VoiceChannels

        Parameters:
        bitrate - The new bitrate for the selected VoiceChannel
        Returns:
        AuditableRestAction
        Update RestAction from #update()
        Throws:
        InsufficientPermissionException - If the currently logged in account does not have the Permission MANAGE_CHANNEL
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the selected Channel's type is not VOICE
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided bitrate is not between 8000-96000 (or 128000 for VIP Guilds)
        See Also:
        Guild.getFeatures(), ChannelManagerUpdatable.getBitrateField(), ChannelManagerUpdatable.update()
